turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Jess?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Eggs?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Oh...uh, no, just some milk, Mom.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Yeah, I'm fine.  Just really hot upstairs.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: I know it's warm...  I wish you'd call someone to check out the air conditioning, Ken.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: So, school going alright?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Okay, I guess.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Making friends?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Maybe we should call a doctor.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: No.  I'm okay.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I'm not taking drugs, Dad.  Can I go to bed now?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Sure...go ahead.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Jesse, please, let's talk about this!

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I'm okay.  Just leave me alone.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Morning.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: How'd you sleep, honey, okay?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: KERRY
turns.text: Hi, guys.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Hi, Kerry.

turns.speaker: KERRY
turns.text: I got your invitation yesterday. Thanks.  Any cute guys gonna be there?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: All of them.

turns.speaker: KERRY
turns.text: Yor dad picking the music again?

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Mom's trying to keep him upstairs.

turns.speaker: MRS. POLETTI
turns.text: There's a Jesse on the phone.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Okay...thanks.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: MRS. POLETTI
turns.text: We're gonna stay out of your way tomorrow night.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: You're going out?

turns.speaker: MRS. POLETTI
turns.text: We're going to bed.

turns.speaker: MRS. POLETTI
turns.text: We're going up to bed now.

turns.speaker: LISA
turns.text: Thanks, Mom.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Mrs. Parker, was Kristen acting different? Did you notice anything strange before she made the attempt?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Kristen specializes in strangeness.  I've spent thousands on psychiatirists.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Did she always have nightmares?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: They've gotten worse since I took away her credit cards.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I'm serious.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Look, Miss Thompson, I don't know what you want from me.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Just some answers.  There are other kids involved, its not just Kristen.  All good kids, smark kids.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I'm sorry to hear that, but you're the experts on this, not me.  If I had any insights, believe me, I'd share them with you.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I'm sure you would.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Now if you'll excuse me, I have to get to the club.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I'll need to take her things.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: The maid packed a suitcase.  Teresa!  Teresa?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I'll get it.  Please, I don't mind.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: First door up the stairs.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Are you crazy?  You'll wake the whole neighborhood!

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: Hi Mom.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Don't "hi Mom" me.  What are you still doing up?  It's past one!

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: I thought I'd wait for you.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Well, I'm home now, so you can go right to sleep.  C'mon, angel.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: It's okay, I'm not tired.  Really.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Kristen, don't start with me.  You know what your shrink said...

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: He's full of shit.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I am not going to let you get me into an argument, goddamn it.  Not tonight.  Now get in bed.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: And you don't want to keep him waiting.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: That's right.  I don't.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Honey, you'll wake the whole neighborhood!

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: Mom?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: What are you still doing up?  It's past one.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: I thought I'd wait for you.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Well, I'm home now, so you can go right to sleep.  C'mon, angel.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: I had such an awful dream.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: Can we talk?  Just for a minute?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Can't it wait till morning?

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: Please Mom?  I just don't want to be alone.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Good morning, Jennifer.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Morning, Doctor Goldman.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: How's your hand?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Menthol, regular, ultra-light.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: They're healing up nicely.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I've been good.  When do I get cigarette priveleges back?

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Don't hold your breath.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Girl, what are you doing?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Watching TV.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I can see that. You watch too damn much TV.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Research.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Oh, right.  You're gonna be a TV star.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Wait and see.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: If Simms catches you in here after lights out, she'll chew my ass ragged.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I gotta stay up, Max.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Jennifer --

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Just tonight, please?  I can't handle the nightmare.  Not tonight.  Not after Phillip.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: If you get caught, I never saw you. Deal?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Deal.  Thanks.

turns.speaker: KINCAID
turns.text: Horseshit.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: No, she's right.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I know who's trying to kill you.

turns.speaker: KINCAID
turns.text: Don't fucking humor us.  We're not in the mood.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: He wears a dirty brown hat.  He's horribly burned.  He has razors on his right hand.

turns.speaker: KINCAID
turns.text: So what do we do about this creep?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Last time, it was me against him.  I wasn't strong enough...alone.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: You didn't think we'd let you go alone?

turns.speaker: KINCAID
turns.text: No fuckin' way.  We're a team.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Kincaid -- we should find the others first...

turns.speaker: KINCAID
turns.text: YOU'RE HOT STIT WITH A LITTLE MUTE KID -- LET'S SEE YOU TAKE A PIECE OF ME!  KRUEGER!

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: What's happening?

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: He's close...

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: I'm glad things have worked out for you.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: I think new York was just what I needed.  So many people.  I never feel alone.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: The city that never sleeps.  So what will you do now?

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: I don't know.  I'm busy with school. New friends.  But I'll never forget the old ones.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: To old friends.  And your new dreams.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: To old friends.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: It was great seeing you again.  I'm glad you dropped by.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: Do you still...see each other?

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Yes.  I'm going to see her tonight.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: You pulled me in somehow, didn't you?

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: I -- I think so!

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I used to live in this house.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: But...it's just a house I've dreamed about.  I dream about it all the time.  Thank you for what you did last night.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Have you ever done that before?  Pulled someone into your dream?

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: When I was a little girl.  Three or four. If I had a nightmare, I'd bring my Dad in. The dream would always get better.  He always used to tell me about it the next day -- he used to think they were his dreams. NANCY When did it stop?

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: When I was still a kid.  My folks got divorced.  After a while, I thought I'd imagined the whole thing.  I guess I didn't.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: It's an amazing gift.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: That man in my dreams.  He's real isn't he?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: He's real.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: Nancy?  Would you sit with me awhile?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: You like gymnastics?

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: I was on the team at school.  I was never very good, though.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: We're not always as good at things as we'd like.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: Yeah, but I was really not good.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: I haven't been able to do that since I was a little girl.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: You did it the other night.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: That was different.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: You never lose a gift like that.  You just forget how to use it.  How about it?  Will you try?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Freddy?

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: He's heavy in the halls...

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: Joey needs us.  I can feel him.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: How do we find him, Kristen?

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: Nancy!

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: He's too strong!  He was never this strong!

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Kristen, can you pull us out?

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: They sedated me.  We're stuck here till it wears off.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Let's try this way.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I think so.

turns.speaker: KRISTEN
turns.text: He's gone.  It's over.  Please don't die, Nancy.  Please.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I'm so proud of you all.  Tell Neil I...

turns.speaker: LORENZO
turns.text: Hi, sweet stuff.  Good news.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: Can't be good news coming from you.

turns.speaker: LORENZO
turns.text: Pulled night duty.  Trimble's sick.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: LORENZO
turns.text: So...got the keys to heaven, baby.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LORENZO
turns.text: The dispensary.  I'm talking clean pharmaceutical high.  A night at Club meth.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: I don't do that shit.

turns.speaker: LORENZO
turns.text: What are these, beauty marks?

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: Those are ancient history.

turns.speaker: LORENZO
turns.text: Oh yeah?  Well, if you're ever in the mood for a history lesson, I'm your teacher, understand?

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: Stay out of my face or I'll go straight to Max.

turns.speaker: LORENZO
turns.text: Now who's gonna take the word of a crazy junkie chick like you?

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: Fuck off.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: The whole wing's devoted ot this program.  That's your office.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: A little basic, but nice.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'll have a file cabinet in there before tomorrow.  The patient's rooms are down here.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: This is Phillip.  We call him The Walker.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Why is that?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Max, where's Kristen?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: She's been waiting outside your office since breakfast.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Puttin' in soem late hours, I see.  If you're trying for O.T., you're in the wrong place.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I just wanted to be here for the kids. how are they?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Restless.  Very restless.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You need me, I'll be here all night.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Thanks, Max.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Save your breath, Ms. Thompson.  Dr. Simms gave me specific instructions. Nobody gets to see Kristen -- especially you.  She made that real clear.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: But Max, she needs me.  It could mean life or death.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: It'll be my last chance.  Pleese?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You got five minutes.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Nothing like a little cheery news to start the day.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Say listen, Doc.  I got a new theory about all these suicides.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Don't hold back on us, Max.  We need all the help we can get.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Fucked up chromosomes, man.  Think about it.  Their parents all dropped acid in the Sixties.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: It beats Dr. Simm's theory.  She thinks it's nothing but sex, drugs, and rock & roll.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Shit, that's what keeps people alive.

turns.speaker: THOMPSON
turns.text: Well, if it isn't my little girl... come to visit her Daddy.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: It's been a long time.

turns.speaker: THOMPSON
turns.text: Yeah, but here you are.  How'd I get so lucky?  I thought you were trying to forget I was alive.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: That's not true.  You're the one who's trying to forget.

turns.speaker: THOMPSON
turns.text: Fred Krueger's dead.  You always had a little trouble understanding that, Princess.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: You know what he did.  He's doing it again.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I think we can stop him this time. Stop him for good.  But we need to know where the bones were hidden.

turns.speaker: THOMPSON
turns.text: I lost too much over this already.  I'm through with it.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: People are still dying.  After all this time.  Stop running away from it.  Daddy, please...don't make me beg.  You owe me.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: It's over.  It's over.

turns.speaker: THOMPSON
turns.text: Nancy...

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Crossed over?

turns.speaker: THOMPSON
turns.text: But I couldn't go until I told you how sorry I am for all the things I've done.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Tell me about the kids.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: You'll get to meet them all tomorrow. They're...survivors.  In a way.  All severely sleep disordered.  Insomnia, narcolepsy, bedwetting...

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: But nightmares are the common thread?

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Right.  They seem to share a group delusion,  a "boogeyman" for lack of a better word.  They're so traumatized, they'll do anything not to sleep.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Anything?

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: We lost a kid about a month ago to Fairview.  I don't know where he got the razor...but he cut off his own eyelids to stay awake.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Oh God.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Ever work with vets?  These kids act like they've got D.S.S. -- Delayed Stress Syndrome. If I didn't know better, I'd swear they'd seen heavy combat.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I wouldn't be so sure they haven't.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: What's that supposed to mean?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I've had some experience with pattern nightmares.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: So I've been told.  Practically an obsession of your.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Call it a passion.  I've got to get going.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Make sure to check in with Max, he'll give you the 25 cent tour.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Ms. Thompson.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Call me Nancy.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Only if you call me Neil.  What was that nursery rhyme all about?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Just something children sing...to keep the boogeyman away.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: You're late.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Didn't get much sleep.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Well, we've got --

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Yes, tell us, Nancy.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: All I can say is this isn't something that's just going to disappear.  you're all going to have to face it.  Fight it. And if you're willing to work together... wiling to stand up to your deepest fears...I think we can beat it.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: This is nice.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Never been here before?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Must have opened while I was away at school.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Most authentic Mexican food in Springwood, which isn't saying much.  your parents still live around here?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: My mother's dead.  Died in her sleep.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: My father an I...well, the family just seemed to fall apart.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Sounds like a rough time.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: It was.  Neil, do you believe in other realities?

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: I've been to Pittsburgh.  Does that count?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I'm serious.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Okay...I believe in different levels of conciousness, that sort of thing...but if you're into UFO's or Atlantis, you've lost me.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: What if I told you your patients are in real physical danger from their dreams?

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: That's a new one.  Is that what they're teaching now at Stanford?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: That's what I know.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: The nightmares are nothing but a symptom of their real problems.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: All right.  Then let's eliminate the symptom for the time being.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: With Hypnocyl?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: You want me to prescribe an experimental psychoactive drug to a bunch of suicidal teenagers?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Just until we get things under control.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Dream deprivation is nothing to fool around with.  you have no business taking it yourself.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I used to be like them, Neil.  I know what they're going through.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: So do I.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Do you?  You told me they're survivors...and they are.  But how much longer they survive is up to us.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: I'm sorry, Nancy.  The answer is no.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: I can't believe I just did that.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Do you think we can get the Hypnocyl in by tomorrow?

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: We're gonna try.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: To who?

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Doesn't matter.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: C'mon.  Let's get out of this rain.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Stop blaming yourself.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: I'm running out of answers. A patient sleepwalks out of a security ward up to a tower with no access.  A girl, alone in a room, dies by jumping six feet straight up into a television set. Nothing makes sense anymore.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Then maybe you're ready.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: The truth.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Try me.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Only if you're willing to put aside everything you've learned and trust me. Can you do that?

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: I can do that.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: You sound like Peter Pan.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Remember -- open mind.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Okay, we're going to try a little group hypnosis.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Take us there, Kristen.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Breathe deeply and relax...starting with your toes, relax everything until there's no tension left in your bodies.  None at all.  Keep following the pendulum...

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: We can try again.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Everybody take five.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: We made it.  Neil, we made it!

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: This isn't possible.  And even if it is...what the hell am I doing here?  Did you drag me in here too?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Take it slowly.  Remember, this is a dream. Anything is possible.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Anything?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: What are we going to do?

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: There's nothing we can do.  It's out of our hands.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: You're not going in.  That's exactly what he wants.  As long as you're on Hypnocyl, it's the only way he can get to you.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Don't you think I know that?  I don't have any choice.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Bullshit.  Getting yourself killed won't do the kids any good.  Besides, we do have a choice.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Assuming your mysterious nun in right.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: I've heard crazier things this week.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: All right.  Whoever she is, I'll admit she seems to know more about Krueger than I do.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: The question is, what happened to Freddy's body?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: They burned him to death in his boiler room, but they were smart enough to hide the remains.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Who would know where they were hidden?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: There's only one man...and its time for him to talk.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Nancy...

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I'll be okay.  Just give me a minute.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Oh Christ.  Simms put Kristen in the Quiet Room for the night.  They sedated her.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Neil, it's no use.  You saw how he is.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Just go.  Kristen needs you.  Keep her awake somehow.  Do it.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: I'm Taryn White.  I only came here because it was a better deal than juvie hall.  Also, I guess 'cause I'm going through some very stange shit.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Your dreams?

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: Hey, everybody has bad dreams.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: Who is he?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Freddy Krueger.  He was a child murderer before he died.  After he died, he became ...something worse.  Six years ago Freddy killed my friends. He almost killed me.  I thought I got rid of him -- but I guess he was too strong.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: What'd you do, take the scenic route?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Sshhh.  No time for that.  Come on.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Okay, straight talk only in here.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: What about Kristen?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: We can't get to her.  I've tried.

turns.speaker: SIMMS
turns.text: And you won't make any progress until you can recognize your dreams for what they are.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: And what are they?

turns.speaker: SIMMS
turns.text: The by-product of guilt.  Psychological scars steaming from moral conflicts and overt sexuality.

turns.speaker: SIMMS
turns.text: We'll begin sedation tonight.  Starting with him.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: You can't!  They'll be defenseless against their dreams.

turns.speaker: SIMMS
turns.text: That's precisely what they need.  Some uninterrupted REM sleep to release all this negative energy.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Neil, please --

turns.speaker: THOMPSON
turns.text: In there.  Charlie Penny owns the place. We knew no one would ever find it.  I'm not even sure I can find it again.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: How do we get in?

turns.speaker: THOMPSON
turns.text: They used to keep a spare key.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: We've got work to do.

turns.speaker: THOMPSON
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: You're about to attend a funeral.  One that's long overdue.

turns.speaker: THOMPSON
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: THOMPSON
turns.text: Listen.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Somebody else is out here.

turns.speaker: THOMPSON
turns.text: No.  We're alone.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Science...I suppose.

turns.speaker: NUN
turns.text: A sad choice.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: There are times when it doesn't offer much comfort.  I've seen you before.  Sister...?

turns.speaker: NUN
turns.text: Mary Helena.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: You do volunteer work at the hospital?

turns.speaker: NUN
turns.text: I come from time to time.  When I'm needed.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: I could've saved them.

turns.speaker: NUN
turns.text: Only one thing can save the children. The unquiet spirit must be laid to rest.  It is an abomination to God and Man.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: I beg your pardon?

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: This wing's been closed for years.  What was this place?

turns.speaker: NUN
turns.text: Purgatory...fashioned by the hands of men.  Twisted, lost souls, the worst of the criminally insane, were locked away in here like animals.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: The whole facility was shut down in the Forties, wasn't it?  Some kind of scandal...

turns.speaker: NUN
turns.text: A young girl on the staff was accidentally locked in here over the holidays.  The inmates managed to keep her hidden for days.  She was raped...hundreds of times. When they found her, she was barely alive...and with child.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: My God.

turns.speaker: NUN
turns.text: That girl was Amanda Krueger.  Her child --

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Freddy.

turns.speaker: NUN
turns.text: The bastard son of a hundred maniacs. Some say he was murdered, though no body was ever found.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: You said something before...about laying him to rest...?

turns.speaker: NUN
turns.text: You must find the remains...and bury them in hallowed ground.

turns.speaker: SIMMS
turns.text: How is he?

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Cooling down.

turns.speaker: SIMMS
turns.text: If he continues having these outbursts, I'll have to have him isolated permanently.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Don't worry, it won't come to that.

turns.speaker: SIMMS
turns.text: What did you think?

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Frankly, I don't understand why some grad school superstar is being treated like a seasoned pro.

turns.speaker: SIMMS
turns.text: She's been doing ground-breaking research on pattern nightmares.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Elizabeth, we don't need any outside help.  I know these kids.  I don't want some hot-shot taking chances with them just so she can get published.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Okay, Group's in session.  Straight talk only in this room.

turns.speaker: SIMMS
turns.text: Today I'd like to start by getting us acquainted with our new staff member, Nancy Thompson.  Let's make her feel welcome.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: That's enough, Kincaid.

turns.speaker: SIMMS
turns.text: There will be no repeat occurences of last night's events.  From now on, your doors will be locked during sleeping hours.  We'll begin a policy of evening sedation.  For everybody.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Elizabeth, I'm prescribing Hypnocyl.  It's a dream suppressant.

turns.speaker: SIMMS
turns.text: I know what it is.  I just can't believe what I'm hearing.  What has she talked you into?

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Nothing.  They're my patients.  It's my decision.  I want the dreams stopped until we get some answers.

turns.speaker: SIMMS
turns.text: I won't allow it.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: I'll go straight to Carver if I have to.  He'll either back me up or accept my resignation.

turns.speaker: SIMMS
turns.text: I'm sorry, Neil.  You brought this on yourself.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: For God's sake, Elizabeth...just try to help the kids, will you?  Listen to them.

turns.speaker: SIMMS
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I'm Will Stanton, and um...I've had a little accident, as you can see.

turns.speaker: TARYN
turns.text: Accident my ass.  I thought this was supposed to be straight talk in here.
